Module it.polimi.ingsw.PSP027
Package it.polimi.ingsw.PSP027.Controller

Class Turn

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.PSP027.Controller.Turn
public class Turn
extends java.lang.Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Turn​(Player playingPlayer, SantoriniMatch santoriniMatch)
    Constructor: it is called by santorini match when the setup of the game is done and the turn of the first player can start.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Phase applyDecorator​(Phase phasetodecorate, GodCard.GodsType godType, boolean bActAsOpponentGod)
    Method to call when applying a decorator
    void ChooseWorker()
    Method that prepares the command to send to the client when asking to choose the worker to play the turn with and actually sends the command
    void CreateBuildPhase​(boolean bMandatory)
    Method that creates a build phase, applying the right decorator to it (also the opponent ones, applied to the already decorated phase by the player's own god)
    void CreateEndPhase​(boolean bMandatory)
    Method that creates an end phase, applying the right decorator to it (also the opponent ones, applied to the already decorated phase by the player's own god)
    void CreateMovePhase​(boolean bMandatory)
    Method that creates a move phase, applying the right decorator to it (also the opponent ones, applied to the already decorated phase by the player's own god)
    boolean CurrentPlayerHasLost()
    Method that checks if the current player has lost
    boolean CurrentPlayerHasWon()
    Method that checks if the player playing this turn has won
    void doBuild​(int chosenCellIndex)
    Method that updates the board with the new build done It creates the next phase (optional build or end depending on what the player's god allows)
    void doBuildForAtlas​(int chosenCellIndex, java.lang.String build_BordD)
    Method that updates the board with the new build done by Atlas It creates the next phase (end)
    void endAction​(int chosenCellIndex)
    Method that updates the board with the end action done It ends the turn It creates another end phase if the god power allows it It clears the player's opponent gods, so that they will not influence again the next turn unless they reset themselves as this player's opponent gods
    Worker getChosenWorker()
    Method to get the worker chosen by the user at the instantiation of the turn

    Method to get the phase list of the turn

    Method to get the player that is playing the turn

    Method to get the match who created the turn

    Method to query in order to tell if the turn is completed
    void MoveWorker​(int chosenCellIndex)
    Method that updates the board with the new position of the worker It checks if the movement caused the player to win and if so ends the turn It creates the next phase (optional move or build depending on what the player's god allows)
    void passBuild()
    Method that skips the Build and creates the next phase (End or Move depending on what the god allows)

  • Constructor Details

    • Turn

      public Turn​(Player playingPlayer, SantoriniMatch santoriniMatch)
      Constructor: it is called by santorini match when the setup of the game is done and the turn of the first player can start. It is given the player who is going to play the turn and the santorini match that called it. With the constructor begins question-answer communication with the client that one by one triggers the instantiation of each phase with the data received form the client
      Parameters:
      playingPlayer - player that plays this turn created by the match
      santoriniMatch - match which the turn belongs to

  • Method Details

    • ChooseWorker

      public void ChooseWorker()
      Method that prepares the command to send to the client when asking to choose the worker to play the turn with and actually sends the command

    • setChosenWorker

      public void setChosenWorker​(Worker chosenWorker)
      Method that sets the chosen worker by the user that will play the turn and instantiates the move phase
      Parameters:
      chosenWorker - worker chosen by the user

    • MoveWorker

      public void MoveWorker​(int chosenCellIndex)
      Method that updates the board with the new position of the worker It checks if the movement caused the player to win and if so ends the turn It creates the next phase (optional move or build depending on what the player's god allows)
      Parameters:
      chosenCellIndex - cell where the worker is moving onto

    • passMove

      public void passMove()
      Method that skips the Move phase and therefore creates the next phase (Build)

    • doBuild

      public void doBuild​(int chosenCellIndex)
      Method that updates the board with the new build done It creates the next phase (optional build or end depending on what the player's god allows)
      Parameters:
      chosenCellIndex - cell where the worker is building

    • doBuildForAtlas

      public void doBuildForAtlas​(int chosenCellIndex, java.lang.String build_BordD)
      Method that updates the board with the new build done by Atlas It creates the next phase (end)
      Parameters:
      chosenCellIndex - cell where the worker is building
      build_BordD - string whose value indicates if the player wants to build a block (B) or a dome (D)

    • passBuild

      public void passBuild()
      Method that skips the Build and creates the next phase (End or Move depending on what the god allows)

    • endAction

      public void endAction​(int chosenCellIndex)
      Method that updates the board with the end action done It ends the turn It creates another end phase if the god power allows it It clears the player's opponent gods, so that they will not influence again the next turn unless they reset themselves as this player's opponent gods
      Parameters:
      chosenCellIndex - cell where the worker is performing the end action

    • passEnd

      public void passEnd()
      Method that skips the end phase. It ends the turn and clears the opponent gods, so that they will not influence again the next turn unless they reset themselves as this player's opponent gods

    • getPlayingPlayer

      public Player getPlayingPlayer()
      Method to get the player that is playing the turn
      Returns:
      the playing player

    • getChosenWorker

      public Worker getChosenWorker()
      Method to get the worker chosen by the user at the instantiation of the turn
      Returns:
      the chosen worker

    • getSantoriniMatch

      public SantoriniMatch getSantoriniMatch()
      Method to get the match who created the turn
      Returns:
      the match

    • getPhaseList

      public java.util.List<Phase> getPhaseList()
      Method to get the phase list of the turn
      Returns:
      the phase list

    • setPhaseList

      public void setPhaseList​(java.util.List<Phase> phaseList)
      Method to set the turn's phase list with a phase list
      Parameters:
      phaseList - phase list to set as this turn's list

    • IsCompleted

      public boolean IsCompleted()
      Method to query in order to tell if the turn is completed
      Returns:
      true if it is completed, otherwise false

    • setCompleted

      public void setCompleted​(java.lang.Boolean completed)
      Method that sets the state of the turn to completed if true, or not completed if false
      Parameters:
      completed - boolean to set for stating whether the turn is completed or not

    • CurrentPlayerHasWon

      public boolean CurrentPlayerHasWon()
      Method that checks if the player playing this turn has won
      Returns:
      true if it has won, otherwise false

    • CurrentPlayerHasLost

      public boolean CurrentPlayerHasLost()
      Method that checks if the current player has lost
      Returns:
      true if it has lost, otherwise false

    • CreateMovePhase

      public void CreateMovePhase​(boolean bMandatory)
      Method that creates a move phase, applying the right decorator to it (also the opponent ones, applied to the already decorated phase by the player's own god)
      Parameters:
      bMandatory - this tells the phase if it's a mandatory phase or an optional one, deciding therefore whether the player loses the game when not able to perform the phase

    • CreateBuildPhase

      public void CreateBuildPhase​(boolean bMandatory)
      Method that creates a build phase, applying the right decorator to it (also the opponent ones, applied to the already decorated phase by the player's own god)
      Parameters:
      bMandatory - this tells the phase if it's a mandatory phase or an optional one, deciding therefore whether the player loses the game when not able to perform the phase

    • CreateEndPhase

      public void CreateEndPhase​(boolean bMandatory)
      Method that creates an end phase, applying the right decorator to it (also the opponent ones, applied to the already decorated phase by the player's own god)
      Parameters:
      bMandatory - this tells the phase if it's a mandatory phase or an optional one, deciding therefore whether the player loses the game when not able to perform the phase

    • applyDecorator

      public Phase applyDecorator​(Phase phasetodecorate, GodCard.GodsType godType, boolean bActAsOpponentGod)
      Method to call when applying a decorator
      Parameters:
      phasetodecorate - phase to decorate
      godType - god with which to decorate the phase
      bActAsOpponentGod - boolean that indicates if the decorator is applied by an opponent
      Returns:
      the decorated phase
